intro: Cacalia pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cacalia pinnatifida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
